title: Hello Please help with the Font!
content:
Hello Everyone,

I am stuck in the middle of my work.  
I was able to find the font but unable to find the location to download them.

Can you kindly correct me; that am I trying to find the correct font face.

Thank you in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500im_/http:/typophile.com/files/JR_4420.png)

JR = " Plate Gt Four MT Std By Adobe"  
Paintings & Decorating Services = " Dutch 766 BT Regular "

Regards,  
Hash

Font: 

 Sabon & Cooperplate 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")
author: hasnain125

comments.content:
'JR': confirming Plate or [Copperplate](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/copperplate), awfully squooshed  
'Painting & Decorating Services': no Dutch 766 but [Hoefler Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/hoefler-text/overview) (comes bundled with iOS) and again terribly stretched

EDIT: even hardly squooshed, can't be Hoefler Text. Fivos is right, should be Sabon Italic.

"JR" looks like an expanded **[Copperplate Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Copperplate%20Gothic%20LT%20Pro%20-%2033%20BC&fid=0014ffdfff748f9902f5d870580cf2fa&fsize=60&text=JR&fit=1)** to me, available from Adobe, Linotype, Bitstream, Tilde (and probably others)  
"Paintings & Decorating ..." must be an expanded **[Sabon (Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype%20%2F%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=Sabon%20-%20Italic&fid=5cffb15740f70db33b21ec0b09ea7830&fsize=60&text=Painting%20%26%20Decorating%20Services&wrap=2)** available from Adobe, Linotype, Monotype and probably Berthold

PS: Ryuk, if you look at the details of /& /g /s you can see it's Sabon not Hoefler Text

Thanks so Much Ryuk & Fvilanakis.

Sabon is more similar to what I was using; thanks for the Tip.  
and Cooperplate Light is what I have used in digitize work.

Thanks again.
And that's Copperplate and not Cooperplate BTW ;)

Ooh! Cooperplate would be a fascinating hybrid. The bulbous serifs of Cooper Black meet the micro serifs of Copperplate. What would the child of this marriage look like?  
Don

A great font for Halloween. Here is Cooperplate, aka the spiky blob :)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317112500im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Cooperplate_6554.jpg)
  
Don

Perfect Don!  
It's more ugly than I could never imagine :)  
If you smooth out some little details, I bet it can be more successful than Comic Sans...

OMG Fivos. A font greater than Comic Sans. My fortune is made!  
Don
